I'm in a shop with $3, and I'm considering whether to buy the Hanged Man card for $3. It destroys up to two selected cards, which could help thin my deck for better pair combinations, especially at ante 8 during the final run. We're at ante 8 in round 17 and just beat the small blind. If I buy the Hanged Man, I can remove two low-rank cards, improving my position as I progress to the big blind and the boss.
**Considering card purchase strategy**

I realize that I need to select targets when using the Hanged Man card, so I can't just buy and use it without planning ahead. If I buy the Hanged Man, I can hold it for later targeting during the round. It lets me destroy up to two cards from my hand, which could be useful when I have junk to remove. The alternative is keeping cash for interest, but I only have $3, which won’t earn any interest. Buying the card feels like the better choice!
**Evaluating purchase strategy**

I’m considering whether to keep my $3 for a purchase after winning the big blind. The Hanged Man costs all my money, but I could sell it later for about $1. However, buying it now might help me remove two low cards from my hand, which could raise my average chips. Still, those low cards affect my scoring negatively since I rely on face cards for better scores. I need a solid plan for maximizing my scoring potential!
**Finalizing the strategy**

Thinning out my low cards could increase my chances of drawing face cards, so buying the Hanged Man feels like a smart move. I’m considering using the Moon for a flush, but my goal is really a two-pair. Destroying those low cards seems beneficial. I also need to keep a slot open for future consumables, and buying the Hanged Man will fill my second slot. So I’ll go ahead and buy the Hanged Man, ensuring my inventory isn't full!

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.
